summary.p: [1] Bullinger has received Vadian's letter [No. 2851 from March 19] well, together with the letter [from] Constance.

[2] Even though he has nothing to report, he entrusts this [city] messenger [Melchior VÃ¶geli] with the present letter, so that Vadian has the opportunity to write to him. The messenger brings good news!
[3] May the Lord strengthen all who call upon His name!

div.p: Greetings and blessings. I have received your letters, most excellent man, which are exceedingly pleasing to me, along with the letter from Constance.
At present, I have nothing to write. However, I have given this to the courier, so that I might give you the opportunity to reply. This courier brings very good news!
May the Lord Jesus strengthen those who call upon His name!
To the most distinguished man, Joachim Vadian, consul of St. Gallen, his ever most esteemed lord. St. Gallen.
